column1: A large, furry creature, scurrying away.
A huge, violent snowstorm, fortunately very far from your position.
Incredible ice pillars, eroded by centuries of wind.
A frozen waterfall, hundreds of feet wide.
A strange, perfectly circular hole, approximately 50’ in diameter.
Enormous blocks of ice, 300’ on each side, spread across a wide plain.
A desolate plain crisscrossed by large crevasses.
Strange tree-like formations made entirely of ice.
An enormous ice cave, its stalactites the size of buildings.

A column of fire, belched from the depths of an ice crevasse. Reddish snow covers its perimeter. A Science roll reveals the red snow is most likely methane snow, contaminated by traces of hydrocarbons.
